example.eg: The confused boy just walked away instead of trying again.
example.egtrans: 男孩被搞糊涂了，他没有再试，而是转身离开。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 迷茫的, 无法了解的, 糊涂的

example.eg: His argument was confused and nobody understood.
example.egtrans: 他的论点混乱，谁也不明白。

example.eg: It confuses me when you give so many instructions all at once.
example.egtrans: 你一下子给我那么多指示，把我都弄糊涂了。

example.eg: I confused Sharon with her mum on the phone last night: she wasn't pleased.
example.egtrans: 我昨天晚上在电话上把莎蓉错当成她妈妈的，弄得她不太高兴。

example.eg: Eddy and Sid are twins, so people often confuse them for one another.
example.egtrans: 艾迪和西德是双胞胎，所以人们经常混淆他们两人。

example.eg: The amount of irrelevant details confused the argument.
Speak to him slowly - he gets confused very easily.
example.egtrans: 慢慢跟他说，他很容易犯糊涂。

example.eg: You've got me confused now; which film are you talking about?
example.egtrans: 现在，你把我弄糊涂了。你在说哪部电影?

example.eg: I always get Greta confused with Verna - they look so much alike.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 把…与…搞混, 对…与…分辨不清

example.eg: I always get confused with my sister: she's also a brunette, and the same height as me.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 被搞混, 被混淆, 被错当成

dsense.name: not to be mistaken for [sth/sb], not to be confused with [sth/sb]

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不要与...弄错, 不可与…搞混
